caption: Just so unorganized!!!! They gave away my order, messed up my order, and front management was a pain to deal with. Totally ruined our Valentine’s Day plans!
American food and the feeling at this spot is great. Fell in love with this place from the 1st taste. The service was very friendly and attentive. The place has a cool atmosphere.
My fav location for quality American food. Nothing but pleasant experiences here. The bill was good for how much you get. Food and feeling reminds me of Kansas City.
American food and the feeling at this place is great. Food was so yummy. I had a brother come into town and he asked me to go back here. The place has a nice feel to it.

Three of us had lunch here on a Saturday afternoon. Great view of the harbor - and very spacious and comfortable seating! Two of us had the half sandwich (turkey blt) with cup of crab bisque and salad; the other had a turkey blt) and everything was really great! The bisque was really tasty - smooth and well seasoned; turkey tasted fresh roasted. The wait staff were not great - seem to disappear for periods of time - and we asked for coffee towards the end of lunch and had to ask again after a long wait when none showed up!
Earl the Sous-Chef was very accommodating with my difficult dinner order, and everything was delicious! Thanks Earl!

I am very disappointed. I went to this restaurant with reservation and I was there on exact time and the lady at the counter still made me wait 6 minutes even tho there was nobody she was constantly on her phone which is way too disrespectful I wonder if she’s the manager or owner since she’s allow to use her phone at the counter also she didn’t even greet us or anything she was so rude to us as if we are getting food for free. Paid $75 for the disgusting food and literally the worse customer service. The person (Tony) was nice. Then the food, My stomach started hurting after I ate because my pizza and the chicken I ordered was burned and I will post that so that the manager can see and tell his chef to cook the food instead of burning it since I ate my stomach has been hurting. Never going there again seriously! Very disappointed with the lady at the main counter and the food. I was so excited to try this place and I regret going there and spending so much money for nothing.

Food was awesome but the service left a lot to be desired. Crab cakes were delicious and the Smith cake was incredible. We waited a really long time for our food, especially dessert and then our coffee was forgotten. We wanted a picture at the end and spent 10 minutes trying to flag down a server. We had to go to a back service area to get their attention. If you are okay with a long meal then the food is worth it!
Underwhelming, extremely overpriced. Dessert was the only good thing

Well, I am surprised to say the least.  The service at this restaurant is terrible.  My party and I waited several hours for our orders.  This was despite us having made a reservation well in advance.  It took at least an hour just for appetizers and drinks to arrive at our table.  By the time my crab chowder finally came out, it was cold.  Items from the menu were also missing.  They ran out of snapper, and didn't have Caesar Salad.  This, despite both being on the menu.  An order of soup for our party was missing.  Expect each course of the meal to take at least an hour, if not more.

Stopped here for a quick dinner at the bar, drinks were awesome and I highly recommend the old fashioned. My pizza was a little burnt and had some of the crust cut off because it must have been too burnt to serve. That being said my dates food was perfect and the bartender was amazing and gave us lots of recommendations on where to go in the area. 100% would go again.

The atmosphere is great. I had the Crab Hash that was really good. It was only 4 tables occupied but took forever for my food to come. I ordered a starter and it came after my main course. My first experience wasn’t good or great. It was ok.

Who would of thought a smaller restaurant in a hotel would be so good? The honey old bay wings were awesome! My wife also loved the salmon plate. Restaurant was clean and the waiter & manager were very pleasant and personable. I would come back from PA just to visit here!

Waiter was nervous and made me uncomfortable. Wine was rancid. Food was average and made no sense (the individual parts were okay but the dish together was not composed well). It was quiet on a Friday night - not the ambiance we expected. Will not be back. Also found a roach in the bathroom.
The place is actually meant to socialize. It has a very unique and good vibe in itself.
I highly recommend eating here!!! Wonderful Experience I had in Watertable. I would love to revisit this place and try other things as well
Highly recommend and looking forward to trying their full menu soon.

This place was great! Wish they validated parking for spending the money, had the crab cake dinner yum!! Food was great, service was nice. They didn’t have the same menu in house as online, but they made a few exceptions. Good job!

Fun classy clean place within a downtown big city multi-level shopping mall building. Has great views of the harbor out the 5th story window and views of the "mall" over the balcony. That just-for-fun classy stop had a good port and a great deep chocolate desert with the youthful/nonclassy name Chocolate Revenge. The sight of the quiet bar added to the classy dessert stop experience. Every once in a while, you gotta go somewhere classy, and you can still have fun.
All in all, a 5/5 kind of place, can't recommend it highly enough.

We were guests of the hotel and came for breakfast. First, the service was impeccable. Every person we encountered was so cheery and engaging. The managers were in the floor the whole time chatting with diners and making sure everyone was taken care of. Second, this was probably the best breakfast buffet we’ve ever had. We came late (11am) and you usually expect the leftovers but everything was fresh and delicious. Kudos to he staff here- they set the bar high for restaurant service.

Terrible service and the food is awful. Walk the few minutes and go to Capitol Grill or Sullivans for nearly the same price.  Bread was burnt and it should have been a sign when they only had one waiter on a Saturday night. Run far away from this place. If I was not so tired and hungry from traveling I would have.  Steak was chewy and did not taste the way local farm to table meat should taste.  Crabcake was burnt and surrounded by more burnt stuff. Flavor of the crab was terrible considering location. I mean nothing crab related should be bad in Baltimore. Crab cakes at Ruby Tuesday are much better and their crab comes out of cans.  Any positive review must have been written by the staff of this place, Marriott should be ashamed to have this restaurant in their hotel.
We had dinner there on Christmas Eve. Excellent food and the server was so nice 🎄good view as well.

I’ve visited the Watertable restaurant in the past and have always had a good experience. However, in the past three days I’ve called morning, noon and night and continually get voice mail. What are they doing over there, sleeping? I just called the hotel RSVP and was put on hold for 8 minutes by Gabby who supposedly is trying to investigate why no one at the restaurant is answering the phone. They probably are not picking up for her either! Gabby thanks for trying, but if this is new “Marriott” customer service standard shame on all of you! Get it together...

Nov 17, 2018: Yes, I went again. It was 9p and we were staying at the hotel anyway. The service for dinner was much better than takeout. And while the Crab Cake Sandwich was awesome (order this if you have no allergies to shellfish or are not vegan/veg), but I had it 2 days in a row already and went for their Curry Squash Risotto instead. It was great, flavor and texture alike (go for this if you're vegan/veg).  Nov 16, 2018: Okay, I got my food 15mins  after complaining, and they gave me 3 macarons as an apology. They definitely forgot my order. I'm here organizing a conference and have to work, and now I am one step closer to stomach ulcers. Thanks.

Ordered 2 burgers. 40 minutes later we watched the bartender give our food to another couple. Went up to the bar and questioned where our food was and bartender claimed he had no idea when it was coming, because they were busy. Cancelled the order. They were preparing for a special event and ignored their customers at the bar tables. Never again!
Don’t waste your time or money. Worst most expensive breakfast ever.
Tony was our waiter and he was awesome. Food was great, service was excellent. Had a wonderful time.
So far, great atmosphere. Timothy is great at service. The bar Larry is fabulous to make your drink. Hands down I've had great service. Food is decent in price.
Expensive but the crab cakes were delicious. Went on a Friday night and we got a nice table overlooking the inner harbor. Bartender made a good mojito, would easily come back again.
Food and Service were good for the price.

Me and my entire 40 person family reserved the restaurant weeks ago. Showed up and still had to wait a half hour for everything to be ready. Then It took them about another 30 minutes for them to just take our order. From there we are currently waiting over an hour for our appatizer. If I wasn't here with my family I would have left. Also I don't think I saw the waitress smile more then once.  Update: after an hour and a half, we finally got our salads and soups. They won me over. Crab soup is fantastic. It did however come luke warm, but it's great.  Double update: I have no words. Back down to 1 star, if I could do zero I would. Finally after 2 and a half hours we get our food. I got the flank steak with a side of pasta. The pasta was like mush, literally tasted like canned spaghetti. The steak was completely over cooked and felt like a leather shoe. The balsamic vinigar they put on it tasted of acid and sourness. Maybe if we weren't a big party, it would be somewhat better, but our experience was terrible, and we left unsaticfied and hungry because barely anyone ate there food. I will now be going out for fast food at the nearest place.
I was fairly underwhelmed, unfortunately. The food and service were all average. I was expecting more.
Nothing to write home about. Much better restaurants close by with larger selections.

Changed menu leads to "sous vide" hanger steak, e.g. meat boiled for hours until gray. Plus over-sugared "sweet potatoes" in a sloppy scoop and underdone brocoli. Add a weak martini to the mix and you have a sad, sad meal. The barman said his complaints are way up. The tacos aren't bad, but avoid the rest.
The blackened rockfish was amazing
Awesome breakfast buffet, great staff.

This is a great place to go for breakfast, lunch and dinner. It is a very professional resturaunt, that is fancy but not too fancy. Everyone is very polite and it has a friendly mood. You ca  tell that their food is well made and not cheap. The only thing I would say is that it is a bit expensive.
It's unique.

Located on the 5th floor of the Renaissance Marriott with fantastic views of the inner harbor and a great breakfast buffet with a made to order omelette station plus great house coffee. What more could you ask for.  The buffet, with coffee (included in the price) was about $20.00 a person. Not bad for downtown area hotel restaurant and for the convenience and quality - very good! The fruit section was great with very fresh tasting and visually appealing produce. The scrambled eggs were light and fluffy and all the meats (bacon, Turkey bacon, chicken and regular sausage) were moist and juicy with  an adequate selection of breads and pastries.  They have a chef station to build your own omelette so you can always customize it to the way you want it.  We ate here on two separate occasions and both times the service was phenomenal. Our server was so friendly, helpful and courteous, most of all it was genuine, she deserves to be recognized (De'Zsa & Timothy) . I would definitely eat here again.
